Method.doc:
Binds hotkeys for Seal

Parameters:
 * mapping - A table containing hotkey modifier/key details for the following (optional) items:
  * show - This will cause Seal's UI to be shown
  * toggle - This will cause Seal's UI to be shown or hidden depending on its current state

Returns:
 * The Seal object
Method.name: bindHotkeys
parameters: * mapping - A table containing hotkey modifier/key details for the following (optional) items:
* show - This will cause Seal's UI to be shown
* toggle - This will cause Seal's UI to be shown or hidden depending on its current state

Method.desc: Loads a plugin from a given file
Method.doc:
Loads a plugin from a given file

Parameters:
 * plugin_name - the name of the plugin, without "seal_" at the beginning or ".lua" at the end
 * file - the file where the plugin code is stored.

Returns:
 * The Seal object if the plugin was successfully loaded, `nil` otherwise

Notes:
 * You should normally use `Seal:loadPlugins()`. This method allows you to load plugins
   from non-standard locations and is mostly a development interface.
 * Some plugins may immediately begin doing background work (e.g. Spotlight searches)
Method.name: loadPluginFromFile
notes: * You should normally use `Seal:loadPlugins()`. This method allows you to load plugins
from non-standard locations and is mostly a development interface.
* Some plugins may immediately begin doing background work (e.g. Spotlight searches)
parameters: * plugin_name - the name of the plugin, without "seal_" at the beginning or ".lua" at the end
* file - the file where the plugin code is stored.
returns: * The Seal object if the plugin was successfully loaded, `nil` otherwise

Method.desc: Loads a list of Seal plugins
Method.doc:
Loads a list of Seal plugins

Parameters:
 * plugins - A list containing the names of plugins to load

Returns:
 * The Seal object

Notes:
 * The plugins live inside the Seal.spoon directory
 * The plugin names in the list, should not have `seal_` at the start, or `.lua` at the end
 * Some plugins may immediately begin doing background work (e.g. Spotlight searches)
Method.name: loadPlugins
notes: * The plugins live inside the Seal.spoon directory
* The plugin names in the list, should not have `seal_` at the start, or `.lua` at the end
* Some plugins may immediately begin doing background work (e.g. Spotlight searches)
parameters: * plugins - A list containing the names of plugins to load

Method.desc: Refresh the list of commands provided by all the currently loaded plugins.
Method.doc:
Refresh the list of commands provided by all the currently loaded plugins.

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * The Seal object

Notes:
 * Most Seal plugins expose a static list of commands (if any), which are registered at the time the plugin is loaded. This method is used for plugins which expose a dynamic or changing (e.g. depending on configuration) list of commands.
Method.name: refreshAllCommands
notes: * Most Seal plugins expose a static list of commands (if any), which are registered at the time the plugin is loaded. This method is used for plugins which expose a dynamic or changing (e.g. depending on configuration) list of commands.
parameters: * None

Method.desc: Refresh the list of commands provided by the given plugin.
Method.doc:
Refresh the list of commands provided by the given plugin.

Parameters:
 * plugin_name - the name of the plugin. Should be the name as passed to `loadPlugins()` or `loadPluginFromFile`.

Returns:
 * The Seal object

Notes:
 * Most Seal plugins expose a static list of commands (if any), which are registered at the time the plugin is loaded. This method is used for plugins which expose a dynamic or changing (e.g. depending on configuration) list of commands.
Method.name: refreshCommandsForPlugin
notes: * Most Seal plugins expose a static list of commands (if any), which are registered at the time the plugin is loaded. This method is used for plugins which expose a dynamic or changing (e.g. depending on configuration) list of commands.
parameters: * plugin_name - the name of the plugin. Should be the name as passed to `loadPlugins()` or `loadPluginFromFile`.

Method.doc:
Shows the Seal UI

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * None

Notes:
 * This may be useful if you wish to show Seal in response to something other than its hotkey
Method.name: show
notes: * This may be useful if you wish to show Seal in response to something other than its hotkey
parameters: * None

Method.doc:
Starts Seal

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * The Seal object
Method.name: start
parameters: * None

Method.doc:
Stops Seal

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * The Seal object

Notes:
 * Some Seal plugins will continue performing background work even after this call (e.g. Spotlight searches)
Method.name: stop
notes: * Some Seal plugins will continue performing background work even after this call (e.g. Spotlight searches)
parameters: * None

Method.desc: Shows or hides the Seal UI
Method.doc:
Shows or hides the Seal UI

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * None
Method.name: toggle
parameters: * None

Variable.desc: If `true` (default), bookmarks are always opened with Safari, otherwise they are opened with the default application using the `/usr/bin/open` command.
Variable.doc: If `true` (default), bookmarks are always opened with Safari, otherwise they are opened with the default application using the `/usr/bin/open` command.
Variable.name: always_open_with_safari

Variable.desc: List of directories where Seal will look for plugins. Defaults to `~/.hammerspoon/seal_plugins/` and the Seal Spoon directory.
Variable.doc: List of directories where Seal will look for plugins. Defaults to `~/.hammerspoon/seal_plugins/` and the Seal Spoon directory.
Variable.name: plugin_search_paths

items.desc: If `true` (default), bookmarks are always opened with Safari, otherwise they are opened with the default application using the `/usr/bin/open` command.
items.doc: If `true` (default), bookmarks are always opened with Safari, otherwise they are opened with the default application using the `/usr/bin/open` command.
items.name: always_open_with_safari

Variable.name: actions

Variable.doc: If `true`, attempt to obtain the favicon for URLs added through the `add` command, and use it in the chooser.
Variable.name: get_favicon
Variable.stripped_doc: If `true`, attempt to obtain the favicon for URLs added through the `add` command, and use it in the chooser.

desc: Allow accessing user-defined bookmarks and arbitrary actions from Seal.
doc: Allow accessing user-defined bookmarks and arbitrary actions from Seal.

items.name: actions

items.doc: If `true`, attempt to obtain the favicon for URLs added through the `add` command, and use it in the chooser.
items.name: get_favicon
items.stripped_doc: If `true`, attempt to obtain the favicon for URLs added through the `add` command, and use it in the chooser.

name: Seal.plugins.useractions
